Classifier, Data, XMIClass
public class XMIClassImpl
extends ClassifierImpl
implements XMIClass

This class implements the XMIClass interface. See the documentation for the XMIClass interface for more details.

Method Detail

add

public void add(Feature f)
Add a feature to this class. It is illegal to add a feature with the same xmiName as a feature in this class or any of its superclasses, although this situation is not currently detected by the framework.
Specified by:
add in interface XMIClass
Parameters:
f - The feature to add

public Feature getXMIFeature(java.lang.String xmiName)

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
The string representation of an XMI class appears as follows:

XMIClass xmiName label id uuid [ owner ]

The xmiName is the XMI name of the object, the label is added if it is not null, the id is added if it is not null, the uuid is added if it is not null, and the owner of the object is added and enclosed in [] if it is not null.

Overrides:
toString in class DataImpl
Returns:
"XMIClass" + the XMI name + the label, if there is one, + the id if there is one, + the uuid if there is one, plus [ owner ] if there is an owner.
